thread.title: Metcash hires former Coles, Woolies execs
thread.title_full: Metcash hires former Coles, Woolies execs

author: news.com.au
title: Metcash hires former Coles, Woolies execs
text:
STRUGGLING grocery wholesaler Metcash has recruited two former senior Coles and Woolworths executives to help lead its turnaround efforts.
METCASH has appointed former Coles managing director Steven Cain to head its core IGA business, while Mark Hewlett has been recruited from Woolworths to lead the company's search for new business.
Mr Cain, who previously worked for Asda in the UK, was brought in by the then Coles Myer to turnaround its flagging supermarkets business in 2003 but abruptly left the position 14 months later, reportedly after clashes with staff. He will join Metcash on August 1 and will have responsibility for IGA's efforts to regain market share and lift profitability in the face of intense competition from Coles, Woolworths and Aldi. "I look forward to working with the supermarkets team, suppliers and independent retailers to provide a more compelling customer offer in what is an increasingly competitive environment," he said in a statement. Mr Hewlett previously worked for Aldi and Lidl in the UK before joining Woolworths to lead the development of its convenience business. He will start work with Metcash on August 12 in the role of executive general manager, new channels. "I am really looking forward to joining Metcash and supporting successful independents," he said in a statement. "The business has great distribution capability on which to build new models."
